node.title: Manfred achieves his dream of becoming a physicist — at age 89
node.alt: Portrait picture of Manfred Steiner who earned his PhD in physics at the age of 89.
node.description: Manfred Steiner, 89, decided to study physics rather than hit around golf balls after retirement — earning his PhD and inspiring others to pursue their ambitions at any age.
node.content:
["An 89-year-old Rhode Island man has achieved a goal he spent two decades working toward and nearly a lifetime thinking about \u2014 earning his PhD\u00a0and becoming a physicist.", "Manfred Steiner recently defended his dissertation successfully at Brown University in Providence.\u00a0", "Dr Steiner cherishes this degree because it's what he always wanted \u2014 and because he overcame health problems that could have derailed his studies.", "\"But I made it, and this was the most gratifying point in my life, to finish it,\" he said at his home in East Providence.", "As a teenager in Vienna, he was inspired to become a physicist after reading about Albert Einstein and Max Planck.", "
'Always stuck in the back of my head'
", "He admired the precision of physics.", "But after World War II, his mother and uncle advised him that studying medicine would be a better choice in turbulent times.", "He earned his medical degree from the University of Vienna in 1955 and moved to the United States just a few weeks later, where he had a successful career studying blood and blood disorders.", "Dr Steiner studied haematology at Tufts University and biochemistry at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology before becoming a haematologist at Brown University.", "", "
Manfred Steiner, who earned his PhD in physics at age 89,\u00a0enjoys the precision of that science.(Stew Milne)
", "He became a full professor and led the haematology section of the medical school at Brown from 1985 to 1994.", "Dr Steiner helped establish a research program in haematology at the University of North Carolina, which he directed until he retired from medicine in 2000 and returned to Rhode Island.", "Dr Steiner and his wife\u00a0Sheila, who is 93, have been married since 1960.", "They have two children and six grandchildren.", "
His professor was sceptical
", "He will celebrate his 90th birthday this month.", "Dr Steiner found medical research satisfying, but it wasn't quite the same as his fascination with physics.", "\"It was something like a wish that was never fulfilled, that always stuck in the back of my head,\" he said.", "At age 70, he started taking undergraduate classes at Brown, one of the Ivy League universities.", "He was planning to take a few courses that interested him, but by 2007, he accumulated enough credits to enrol in the PhD\u00a0program.", "Physics Professor Brad Marston was sceptical when Dr Steiner entered his quantum mechanics class.", "Professor Marston had taught graduate students in their 40s, but never in their 70s.", "Then he realised how serious Dr Steiner was about the subject and how hard he worked.", "
'Not looking for a paid job'
", "Professor Marston became Dr Steiner's adviser for his dissertation.", "\"He has written many papers in medical science, more papers than I've written in physics. He already had a scientific way of thinking that younger students have to develop,\" Professor Marston said.", "\"And any research problem that's worth its salt, you're going to run into roadblocks.", "\"If you let obstacles discourage you, you won't get anywhere.", "\"One thing that's really true about Manfred is he perseveres.\"", "", "
Fresh from earning his PhD in physics, Manfred Steiner works from his Rhode Island home.(Stew Milne)
", "Dr Steiner defended his dissertation in September after recovering from a serious medical condition.", "\"I'm not looking for a paid job. I'm past that,\" he said, laughing.", "Guinness World Records stated a 97-year-old man in Germany in 2008 was the oldest person to earn a doctorate.", "Though he's not the oldest, attention has been intense.", "Brown University featured Dr Steiner on its website after he earned his PhD\u00a0and people across the country contacted him to ask for advice on pursuing their dreams later in life.", "Dr Steiner told a 57-year-old aspiring mathematician that\u00a0\"you're still a youngster, by all means do math\".", "He said his advice was: do what you love to do.", "\"Do pursue it because later in life you maybe regret it, that you didn't do that,\" he said.", "\"You wish you could've followed this dream.\"", "AP"]
